intro: Astronia stuhlmannii, commonly known as the Stuhlmann's astronia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in open woodlands and along riverbanks, thriving in well-drained soils. Astronia stuhlmannii is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its delicate appearance and ability to attract pollinators.
